page.title: 01THE GARTH MOUNTAIN AREA
page.content: This map block covers an area at the start of the South Wales Valleys. It is dominated by the Garth Mountain which is surrounded immediately by three villages. Gwaelod-y-Garth is an old mining village which clings to the side of the Garth Mountain. Efail Isaf is a small village on the top of the mountain which is currently under threat of becoming an overspill area for Cardiff. Nantgarw is a mining village with a working mine and from the Northern end of the village runs the Treforest Industrial Estate which was built in the 1930's and is now in decline. On the south eastern corner of the block is the village of Taffs Well - the largest in the area and once famous locally for it's healing spa.
